s3.message: Blocking rules determine addresses that Adblock Plus should block.

s33.message: This text must be present in the address to be blocked.

s35.message: The preceding text must be the end of the address.

s42.message: Blocking rules can have a number of options to fine-tune their behavior.

s77.message: Exception rules are built the same as blocking rules, they define which addresses should be allowed even if matching blocking rules exists.

s80.message: Rules starting like this are exceptions, they will override blocking rules.

s82.message: This part of the rule defines which addresses it is applied to, it is structured the same as for blocking rules.

s84.message: This type option prevents the exception from being applied to scripts.

s95.message: This special type option indicates that Adblock Plus should be completely disabled on pages that this rule applies to.

s102.message: An exclamation mark at the beginning of the rule indicates a comment.

s104.message: This text will not be used for blocking, you can write anything you want.

s123.message: Specify a list of domains, separated by bar lines (|), on which a filter should be active. A filter may be prevented from being activated on a domain by preceding the domain name with a tilde (~).

s124.message: Specify whether a filter should be active on third-party or first domains

s135.message: It is generally recommended that users install the Element Hiding Helper for Adblock Plus to assist them in the generation of element hiding rules.

s137.message: is used as a placeholder for element selectors.

s159.message: Matches the element with the unique id "advert"

s161.message: Matches a table with a height of 100 and a width of 100

s163.message: Matches div elements that have exactly the style specified

s164.message: Matches elements with the class "link" that are enclosed within elements with the id "advert"

s165.message: Matches elements with the class "link" that are immediately preceded by elements with the id "advert"

s166.message: Matches links to any pages hosted on http://example.com/

s167.message: Matches div elements that start with the style specified

s168.message: Matches div elements that end the style specified

s169.message: Matches div elements that containing the style specified

s170.message: The above filters are only examples of valid element hiding rules. Any CSS selector supported by Firefox can be used for element hiding.
